Day 1 (March 14, 2022): Departure from Salt Lake City

* Self-driving or taking a taxi from Salt Lake City to Abilene (duration: 16 hours 59 mins, distance: 1,740 km, cost: 87 for self-driving, 1740 for taxi)

Day 2-3 (March 15-16, 2022): Explore Abilene

* Self-driving or taking a taxi within Abilene to visit attractions such as the Frontier Texas! museum and the Grace Museum (duration: varies, distance: varies, cost: 22 for self-driving, 446 for taxi)
* Staying in one of the accommodations in Abilene with visitor-friendly house rules (cost: varies)

Day 4-5 (March 17-18, 2022): Travel from Abilene to Amarillo and Explore Amarillo

* Self-driving or taking a taxi from Abilene to Amarillo (duration: 4 hours 10 mins, distance: 446 km, cost: 22 for self-driving, 446 for taxi)
* Visiting attractions in Amarillo such as the Cadillac Ranch and the American Quarter Horse Hall of Fame & Museum (cost: varies)
* Staying in one of the accommodations in Amarillo with visitor-friendly house rules (cost: varies)
* Self-driving or taking a taxi from Amarillo to Salt Lake City on March 18, 2022 (duration: 13 hours 45 mins, distance: 1,419 km, cost: 70 for self-driving, 1419 for taxi)

Total estimated budget for transportation and accommodations: $2,628 for self-driving, $4,523 for taxis, $10,000 for accommodations (with a contingency of $2,000). The total estimated budget is within the updated budget of $12,000.

Note: The estimated budget does not include costs for meals, attractions, and other incidental expenses. It also assumes that the group will be sharing transportation costs equally.
